info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 2:26PM EDT until April 30 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Charlotte and Halifax Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Widespread lowland flooding in fields on left bank and woods on right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 04/26/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Roanoke (Staunton) River Randolph 24.0 22.1 Sat 1 pm EDT 19.8 16.4 15.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EDT.
